intro: Aulomyrcia bicarinata, commonly known as the two-ribbed fern, is a unique species belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive fronds that have two prominent longitudinal ribs, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its reproductive structures include sori that are clustered along the margins of the fronds. Aulomyrcia bicarinata is valued for its ornamental appearance and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
